repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.unittitle: Raul Ruiz film and videotape collection 1960-1996
did.langmaterial: Material in Spanish French English Italian
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Acclaimed Chilean filmmaker now living in exile in France. Feature and short films in Spanish, French, Italian, and English. Includes reels of audio and video film. One set of videocassettes contains Ruiz' interpretation of Dante's Inferno, produced for television by the BBC. Some films deal with social conditions in Chile during the 1960s and 1970s. Others are fabulist films set in various places around the world. Also included are use copies of the collection in DVD and VHS formats.

note.label: Language of Materials
note.p: Language: Material in Spanish French English Italian

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
Also, original audiovisual materials are CLOSED to patron use. Use copies are available in the collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Raul Ruiz film and videotape Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Raul Ruiz film and videotape collection were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a deposit in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Paula Jeannet Mangiafico, 1996; and John Mayrose, May 2007
This collection is minimally processed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Acclaimed Chilean filmmaker now living in exile in France.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Feature and short films in Spanish, French, Italian, and English. Includes reels of audio and video film. One set of videocassettes contains Ruiz' interpretation of Dante's Inferno, produced for television by the BBC. Some films deal with social conditions in Chile during the 1960s and 1970s. Others are fabulist films set in various places around the world. Also includes 5 DVD use copies and 3 VHS use copies.

Feature and short films in Spanish, French, Italian, and English. Includes reels of audio and video film. One set of videocassettes contains Ruiz' interpretation of Dante's Inferno, produced for television by the BBC. Some films deal with social conditions in Chile during the 1960s and 1970s. Others are fabulist films set in various places around the world.

accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials are CLOSED to patron use. Use copies are available for some items in the collection.
